description: The erection of a 3-storey building at the rear of the site for use as a NHS Family Centre (Class D1).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The details of the following sections, elevations and facing materials to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development: 

1. Sample panel to be erected on site displaying all facing and roofing materials including mortar mix, method of pointing and brick bond.
2. Section and elevation at a scale of 1:20 of typical window showing glazing bars, cill, lintel and jambs. 
3. Eaves and string course detail at a scale of 1:5.

These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policies B1, B3 and B7.
Condition : 3 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least 5 years following the completion of the development hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policy N7.
Condition : 4 - Details of the design of building foundations and the layout, with dimensions and levels, of service trenches and other excavations on site in so far as these items may affect trees on or adjoining the site, shall be submitted to and approved by the Council as the local planning authority before any works on site are commenced.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policy N7.
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of development, details of the provision of bicycle storage on the site [including at least 4 bicycle parking spaces to be provided close to front entrance for visitors, and at least 4 more weather-protected, securable bicycle parking spaces] shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. All of the spaces shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the building, and thereafter permanently maintained and retained for the use of occupiers and users of the building.

Reason: To comply with the requirements of policies TR22 and DS8 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policy T3.
Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the drawings hereby approved, the roof areas at first floor level shall not be used as roof terraces. 

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policy SD6.
Condition : 7 - All areas of obscure glazing shown on the approved drawings, shall be installed as such prior to the first occupation of the building, and thereafter permanently retained and maintained as such. 

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policy SD6.
Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Class D1 of the Schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order, 1987, or any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order, the premises shall only be used for the provision of health services and assocaited activities, and they shall not be used for any other purposes.

Reason: To ensure that the future occupation of the building does not adversely affect the adjoining premises/immediate area by reason of noise, traffic congestion and excessive on-street parking pressure in accordance with policyies RE2, EN5 and TR12 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and those of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006] with particular regard to policies S2 and T1.
